The app also records data about your play style: \n • the time spent solving the puzzles, \n • and the number of moves until a solution is found.

This application is developed as a Master\'s project at the science faculty of Sorbonne Université. One focus is the study of a combinatorial satisfaction problem named Locally-Envy-Free (LEF) and we want to evaluate the difficulty of a given instance for a resolution by a person.

This prototype presents the problem as a puzzle game and allows us to collect resolution data for a set of preselected instances. This data will be used to study the correlation between instance features and human evaluated difficulty.
1. This is a puzzle game with several actors to which you need to give resources. Each one has to get a different resource.
2. Every actor has its own preferences concerning the resources. For example the first actor prefers power over water and prefers water over the leaf.

3. No actor can be jealous of its left and right neighbors for a solution to be accepted. For example, if you give the leaf to the first actor and power to the second, the first agent is jealous because it would prefer power over the leaf.
